ygData.subject: RE: How to know if Anthem is really working
ygData.msgSnippet: It seems to me that most people abandon the tentacle whip at a relatively early point in the game due to the reasons that you list below...it is a nice starter
ygData.messageBody:
It seems to me that most people abandon the tentacle whip at a relatively
early point in the game due to the reasons that you list below...it is a
nice starter weapon, but becomes useless later due to the damage/proc ratio.

Does anyone of a higher level have any stats on using the Tentacle Whip? I
think it is likely that the frequency an item procs is affects by your
Dexterity, and in some cases by your level as well. Would the whip be more
effective if at, say, level 25 it proc'd 80% of the time compared with the
20% (or whatever) it does at lower levels?

I have no idea about this, just wondering...I have never even held a
tentacle whip letalone snap it at someone, so this is just my curiosity.

Faras Tar'Linedhel, Bard of the 20th song
E'ci


By the way...if I die 3 times in one night at Unrest again I am going to get
a little frustrated :-( I can't reiterate how important a good, calm,
coordinated group is for ones health...especially we bards. A spastic group
will only get you killed.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 20, 1999 1:57 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] How to know if Anthem is really working
>
>
> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
> On Tue, 20 Jul 1999, Elena Glenn wrote:
> >
> > How would a combination of a tentacle whip and a Polished
> Granite Tomahawk
> > be? I have both, and was planning on using them at level
> 17 for dual wield.
> > Which shoud be the primary weapon, or is there a better
> combo? I also have
> > a Dragoon Dirk. Any comments would be appreciated. Thanks
>
> The tentacle whip is a good starter magical weapon, that's
> about it. I suppose if you were grouped with a druid who
> could put a damage shield on you, and you played Hymn during
> your battles, you could use the whip's lifetap effect to
> extend combat long enough that the monster mostly kills itself
> trying to hurt you. But the frequency with which it procs is
> not great enough to offset the low damage ratio.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
